result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric A Hair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Upon successful completion of probation, Court will grant expungement.

timeConds.notes: *With Huber privileges for work and treatment; sentence to commence on July 1, 2016 by 5:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Upon successful completion of probation, Court will grant expungement.

BRANCH 31 (HONORABLE JUDGE RIFELJ) FOR BRANCH 04 (HONORABLE JUDGE HANRAHAN)

Defendant Eric A Hair in court with attorney Zoe Everett on behalf of attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 04.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court with attorney Greg Renden for Robert J Hampton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea hearing.  Attorney Hampton is unavailable.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment to allow time for the defendant to obtain mental health/AODA treatment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant now qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 21.  Clerk mailed notice to PD's office.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEFENDANT'S BAIL BOND FORM INDICATE THE WRONG INFORMATION REGARDING THE JUDGE (BRASH) AND THE WRONG COURTROOM.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Eric A Hair not in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eric A Hair in court with Student Intern Solomon Gatton under the supervision of attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Eric A Hair in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
